title: SSRF via filter bypass due to lax checking on IPs

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

Hi @nickvergessen  

Hope you are doing well. I am extremely sorry to bother you knowing well that all of you are working hard and have a busy schedule to maintain, but could you please share any updates on this report? Any replies are appreciated.

Sorry, this somehow slipped through.

It's fixed with https://github.com/nextcloud/server/pull/34160

Thanks a lot for your report again. This has been resolved in our latest maintenance releases and we're working on the advisories at the moment.

If you have a GitHub account please let us know the username, and we will associate it with the advisory.
Thanks for the heads up! Here is my GitHub account https://github.com/OBITORASU, I go by the username OBITORASU. Also, is this report eligible for a bounty?
Almost forgot, if possible could you also mention my friend in the advisory? His GitHub account is https://github.com/w1redch4d (w1redch4d), wouldn't have found this bug without his valuable help.

> Also, is this report eligible for a bounty?

Bounty decision will mostlikely be made while we finish up the advisory.
@nickvergessen thank you for your time, that would be all from my side. I will wait for the final decision and the advisory, have a great day ahead :)
@nickvergessen sorry for the ping, just wanted to know if you have any updates for me regarding the advisory.
Sorry, I got sick and then was vacation season. Should happen next week.
Thanks for the update. Hope you are doing well now. Belated merry Christmas and a happy upcoming new year to you and your team.
